applicable_checks.reason: Universal requirement for all network devices to enforce strong password policies
Essential protection against brute-force attacks on all device types
Role-based access control applicable to all network devices
Critical for securing remote management access on all devices
Physical console access security required for all devices
Privileged EXEC mode protection applicable to all devices
Audit logging is mandatory for all network devices
Ensures adequate log retention on all devices
Centralized logging required for all network devices
Accurate time correlation needed for all device logs
Time synchronization critical for all network devices
Prevents time manipulation attacks on all devices
SNMP security applicable to all managed devices
Restricts SNMP access on all network devices
Legal notice banners required for all devices
Attack surface reduction applicable to all devices
Web management interface security for all devices
Secure remote access required for all devices
Insecure protocol must be disabled on all devices
SSHv2 required for secure management on all devices
Idle session timeout applicable to all devices
Detects dead sessions on all network devices
Centralized authentication applicable to all devices
Fallback authentication required on all devices
Enterprise authentication for all managed devices
Authentication enforcement on all access lines
Configuration audit trail required for all devices
Configuration backup applicable to all devices
Control plane security applicable to all routing/switching devices
Management interface isolation for all devices
Documentation requirement for all device interfaces
Password encryption required in configuration on all devices

excluded_checks.reason: Specific implementation details not provided - requires device type and role context
Requires knowledge of device type - only applicable to switches with switchport capability
Layer 2 security feature - only applicable to switches, not routers or firewalls
Layer 2 security feature - only applicable to switches with VLAN capability
Layer 2 security feature - only applicable to switches, requires DHCP snooping
Layer 2 broadcast control - only applicable to switches, not routers or firewalls

findings.evaluation: Password minimum length is set to 10 characters, exceeding the requirement of >= 9. All user accounts use encrypted passwords (type 5).

N-01.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Enable secret is properly configured with MD5 encryption (type 5). No plaintext enable password is present.
criteria_met: Enable secret configured with type 5 (MD5) encryption

N-02.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Privilege separation is properly implemented with only 1 privilege 15 account (admin), and operational accounts using lower privilege levels (7 and 5). This follows the principle of least privilege.
criteria_met: Limited number of privilege 15 accounts (1 account)
Custom privilege levels defined for specific roles

N-03.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: VTY lines are properly protected with access-class 10, which permits only the management network (10.1.0.0/16) and explicitly denies all other sources with logging.
criteria_met: ACL permits only specific management network

N-04.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Session timeout is configured to 10 minutes on both console and VTY lines, meeting the recommended timeout value of <= 60 minutes.

N-05.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: IOS version 15.2 is identified. This is a stable release version. However, specific sub-version and security patch level should be verified against Cisco security advisories to ensure no critical CVEs affect this version.
criteria_met: IOS version is a RELEASE version (15.2)
Version format indicates stable production code

N-06.recommendation: Verify the specific sub-version (15.2.x) against Cisco Security Advisories to ensure no critical vulnerabilities exist. Consider upgrading to the latest recommended release in the 15.2 train or newer if security advisories recommend it.

findings.evaluation: Logging is properly enabled with multiple destinations configured including buffered, console, and monitor logging with appropriate severity levels.
criteria_met: Multiple logging destinations configured (buffered, console, monitor)

N-07.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Two remote syslog servers are configured (10.1.1.100 and 10.1.1.101) with informational level logging, providing redundancy and centralized log management.
criteria_met: Logging trap level set to informational
Redundant syslog servers for high availability

N-08.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Logging buffer size is set to 65536 bytes (64KB), which exceeds the minimum requirement of 32768 bytes (32KB), providing adequate buffer space for log retention.

N-09.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Logging levels are appropriately configured: trap/buffered/monitor at informational (level 6) for detailed logging, and console at warnings (level 4) to reduce console noise while capturing important events.
criteria_met: Sufficient detail for security event reconstruction

N-10.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Default SNMP community strings 'public' and 'private' are explicitly disabled. A complex community string 'Mgmt$3cur3' (11 characters with special characters) is configured with ACL protection.
criteria_met: Complex characters used in community string

N-11.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: SNMP community string has ACL 20 configured, which permits only two specific management servers (10.1.1.100 and 10.1.1.101) and explicitly denies all other sources with logging.
criteria_met: ACL permits only specific management IPs (2 hosts)

N-12.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

evidence: snmp-server user snmpadmin SNMPV3-RO v3 auth sha $ecur3P@ssw0rd priv aes 128 $ecur3Pr1v@t3
findings.evaluation: SNMPv3 is properly configured with both authentication (SHA) and privacy (AES-128). Default SNMPv1/v2c community strings are disabled. SNMPv2c community string present has strict ACL restrictions.
criteria_met: SNMPv2c has strict ACL and complex community string

N-13.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant. Consider removing SNMPv2c community string if SNMPv3 is fully supported by all management systems.

evidence: ! no tftp-server commands (comment indicates no TFTP configured)
findings.evaluation: No TFTP server configuration is present in the running configuration. TFTP service is not enabled.

N-14.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: All unnecessary legacy services are explicitly disabled including HTTP/HTTPS servers, finger, TCP/UDP small servers, and PAD service.

N-15.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Unused interface GigabitEthernet0/2 is properly shutdown with a clear description indicating it is unused. No IP address is configured.

N-17.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: NTP authentication is properly configured with MD5 authentication key, trusted key defined, and both NTP servers configured to use authentication key 1.

N-18.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: TCP keepalives are enabled for both inbound and outbound connections, helping to detect and terminate dead TCP sessions.

N-19.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Finger service is explicitly disabled, preventing information disclosure about users logged into the device.

N-20.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Both HTTP and HTTPS servers are disabled, eliminating web-based attack vectors. Management is performed via SSH as indicated by VTY transport input ssh configuration.

N-21.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: IP source routing is globally disabled, preventing attackers from specifying routing paths and bypassing security controls.

N-22.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Directed broadcast is disabled on external interface GigabitEthernet0/0, preventing the device from being used as an amplifier in Smurf attacks.

N-23.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Proxy ARP is disabled on all active interfaces, preventing potential man-in-the-middle attacks and reducing unnecessary ARP traffic.
criteria_met: Proxy ARP disabled on external interface (Gi0/0)
Proxy ARP disabled on internal interface (Gi0/1)

N-24.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: ICMP redirects are disabled on all active interfaces, preventing attackers from redirecting traffic through malicious routes.
criteria_met: ICMP redirects disabled on all interfaces

N-25.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: ICMP unreachables are disabled on all active interfaces, preventing information disclosure and potential DoS attacks using ICMP unreachable messages.
criteria_met: ICMP unreachables disabled on external interface
ICMP unreachables disabled on internal interface

N-26.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant. Note that this may impact troubleshooting; consider rate-limiting instead if operational issues arise.

findings.evaluation: ICMP mask reply is disabled on the external interface, preventing network reconnaissance through subnet mask disclosure.

N-27.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Identd service (RFC 1413) is disabled, preventing information disclosure about TCP connections and user identification.

N-28.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: Domain lookup is disabled, preventing delays from DNS resolution attempts on mistyped commands. A local domain name is configured for internal use.
criteria_met: Local domain name configured for internal use

N-29.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: PAD (Packet Assembler/Disassembler) service for X.25 protocol is disabled, eliminating an obsolete and potentially vulnerable service.

N-30.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: CDP is globally disabled and also explicitly disabled on the external interface, preventing information disclosure about device model, IOS version, and network topology.

N-31.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

findings.evaluation: BOOTP server is disabled, preventing the device from responding to BOOTP requests which could be exploited for network reconnaissance or DoS attacks.

N-32.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant

evidence: No monitor session configuration found in running-config
findings.evaluation: No SPAN or monitor sessions are configured, eliminating the risk of unauthorized traffic monitoring or data exfiltration through SPAN ports.

N-38.recommendation: No action required - configuration is compliant. If SPAN sessions are needed for legitimate IDS/IPS or network analysis, ensure they are documented with business justification and destination ports are physically secured.
